title: Systems Thinking for Frontend Engineers
excerpt: Treating frontend apps like distributed systems changed how I debug, design, and prioritize reliability.
markdown:
When UI feels flaky, the root cause is often **coordination**, not styling.

## A better framing

I started modeling async UI flows as independent services with contracts, retries, and observability.

## Practical playbook

1. Define state transitions explicitly
2. Add event-level logging early
3. Fail loudly in development

## Result

Debug cycles became shorter and regressions became easier to isolate.

title: Shipping Cleanly Under Real Deadlines
excerpt: A workflow for balancing speed and code quality during intense project windows.
markdown:
Deadlines are normal. Panic is optional.

## Rules I follow

- Establish a tiny, testable core first
- Keep complexity behind stable interfaces
- Cut polish, never clarity

```ts
export function shipScope(items: string[]) {
  return items.filter((item) => !item.startsWith('nice-to-have:'));
}
```

The key is to preserve confidence while trimming scope.
